intro: Schwenckia karstenii, commonly known as the Karsten's false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a disk of tubular flowers, typical of the family. Schwenckia karstenii is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
